app.viewmanagers

Class SettingsViewManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • app.viewmanagers.SettingsViewManager

  • public class SettingsViewManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the view manager for the Settings component, which appears as a pop up when "settings" is entered as a command or if the settings button is clicked. It lets the user set the directory of the .json document, as well as options to enable/disable random list cell colors and notifications.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Clicking on the save button passes all options to rootViewManager.

      • showChooser

        private void showChooser(javafx.stage.DirectoryChooser directoryChooser)
        This is called when the user clicks on the "browse" button. It opens up a finder/browser/explorer that allows the user to select a directory graphically. There is also a textfield next to the browse button, should the user prefer entering the directory manually.
        Parameters:
        directoryChooser -

      • focusOnButton

        public void focusOnButton()
        UX feature. Set the default button as cancel to prevent accidental changing of settings.

      • cancelFocusOnButton

        public void cancelFocusOnButton()

      • setAbsolutePathToDirectory

        public void setAbsolutePathToDirectory(java.lang.String absolutePath)
        This is called internally when opening the settings view. This fills the text field with the file path as set in settings.json.
        Parameters:
        absolutePath -

      • setNotificationsEnabled
